definition: to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
forced labor to repay a debt

sentences.english: They decided to settle their debts with their creditors, and call it quits.
sentences.chinese: 他们商议决定以资抵债，两下扯平。

sentences.english: When in fact they probably don't even have one repossessed car that is for sale.
sentences.chinese: 但事实上他们可能连一颗抵债车即出售。

sentences.english: Market fears of bank insolvency, particularly, have been assuaged.
sentences.chinese: 市场对银行资不抵债的担忧，尤其得到了舒缓。

sentences.english: But since money is not really insolvent, that what can they do it?
sentences.chinese: 但真的资不抵债还不起钱了，那又能如何呢？

sentences.english: In both cases the problem was insolvency, not just a shortage of liquidity.
sentences.chinese: 两者的问题都是资不抵债，而不仅仅是流动性短缺。

sentences.english: He offered to work out the debt, but I needed the money more.
sentences.chinese: 他提出做工来抵债，可是我更需要现钱。

sentences.english: Insolvency matters are covered under the Bankruptcy Code.
sentences.chinese: 资不抵债事项由《破产法典》调整。

definition: to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to owe a debt/the sum owed
